etymology.description: semantic: 廾(廾) (gǒng, "two hands") + phonetic: 㡀(㡀) (bì, "cloak") = hands holding a torn cloak -> rags
etymology.interpretation: The character 敝(bì, "rags") uses the 廾(廾) (gǒng, "two hands") as a semantic component to indicate actions done by hands, combined with the phonetic 㡀(㡀) (bì, "cloak") to suggest a worn or torn piece of clothing.

examples.chinese: 他的家境贫寒(他的家境貧寒)，只能穿敝衣而已(只能穿敝衣而已)。
examples.pinyin: tā de jiājìng pínhán (tā de jiājìng pínhán)，zhǐ néng chuān bì yī ér yǐ (zhǐ néng chuān bì yī ér yǐ)。
examples.english: His family's financial situation is poor, and he can only wear rags.

examples.chinese: 他因长期劳作(他因長期勞作)，只得穿敝衣归乡(只得穿敝衣歸鄉)。
examples.pinyin: tā yīn chángqí láozuò (tā yīn chángqí láozuò)，zhǐ dé chuān bì yī guī xiāng (zhǐ dé chuān bì yī guī xiāng)。
examples.english: Because he labors for a long time, he can only return home in rags.

examples.chinese: 敝衣难遮风寒(敝衣難遮風寒)。
examples.pinyin: bì yī nán zhē fēng hán (bì yī nán zhē fēng hán)。
examples.english: Rags cannot block the cold wind.
